meanings.definition: The quality or state of being flat.
meanings.sent1: The flatnesses of the paper made it easy to stack neatly.
meanings.sent2: She admired the flatnesses of the desert landscape.
meanings.sent3: The painter exaggerated the flatnesses of the horizon in his artwork.
meanings.sent4: The flatnesses of the pancake were perfect, just like a smooth mirror.
meanings.sent5: The flatnesses of the road stretched out endlessly before them.

meanings.definition: The lack of variation or unevenness in a surface.
meanings.sent1: The flatnesses of the table made it ideal for playing board games.
meanings.sent2: The flatnesses of the mirror reflected her image clearly.
meanings.sent3: The flatnesses of the cake made it look like a giant cookie.
meanings.sent4: The flatnesses of the lake made it seem like a giant mirror.
meanings.sent5: The flatnesses of the floor made it easy to roll a ball smoothly.

meanings.definition: The absence of curves or bends in an object.
meanings.sent1: The flatnesses of the ruler made it perfect for drawing straight lines.
meanings.sent2: The flatnesses of the sheet of paper made it easy to fold neatly.
meanings.sent3: The flatnesses of the straw made it impossible to drink a milkshake.
meanings.sent4: The flatnesses of the bookshelf made it look like a long, straight line.
meanings.sent5: The flatnesses of the wall made it ideal for hanging pictures.
